p: Over the last five decades, dengue has emerged as a major health problem in the tropical regions worldwide including Latin America and the Caribbean [ 2, 10, 22, 36]. More recently chikungunya and Zika virus emerged in the Americas causing significant epidemics in most of the countries infested with Aedes aegypti [ 67– 70]. Mexico is considered one of the endemic dengue countries in the region and since 2015 with the emergence of chikungunya and Zika virus, the three arboviruses have been co-circulating in many areas of the country [ 71– 73].
